newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan April electricity demand up 0.5 pct yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Japan April electricity demand up 0.5 pct yr/yr.

text.p: Japan's electricity demand in April inched up on a year-on-year basis as brisk industrial demand outweighed a decline in household use, an industry body said on Friday.

Demand for electricity supplied by Japan's nine major power utilities in April grew 0.5 percent from the same month a year earlier to 61.8 billion kilowatt hours (kWh), the Federation of Electric Power Companies said.
Household electricity demand fell by 2.9 percent to about 18.2 billion kWh as higher-than-average temperatures in April depressed heating demand.

Large-lot industrial demand, on the other hand, rose by 3.9 percent to 21.5 billion kWh, reflecting stable growth in electricity demand from such industries as steel, machinery and chemical sectors, the federation said.
